alert.note: Alert for Cavalier; Eastern Walsh County; Grand Forks; Nelson; Pembina; Ramsey; Western Walsh County (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 20 at 7:05PM CDT until April 22 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT FRIDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY TO 1 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches, with locally higher amounts possible. Winds gusting as high as 35 to 45 mph on Friday. * WHERE...Areas along and north of the highway 200 corridor. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 1 PM this afternoon to 4 AM CDT Friday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Friday to 1 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Visibilities less than a quarter mile are anticipated from heavy snow rates. Accumulating snow will make travel very difficult. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With ongoing flooding and water filled ditches, it is possible that vehicles may slide off the road into very cold water. Uncertainty remains in snow amounts and associated impacts, due to melting and compaction.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at travel.dot.nd.gov and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
